pin_mapping module

pin_mapping.GPIOCHIP = 'gpiochip1'

Constant that contains the name of the GPIO chip on the SBC. As default, this is set to the 40-pin GPIO chip of LibreComputer’s “Le Potato”.

pin_mapping.PIN_NAME = {'GPIOA9_5': 5, 'GPIOAO_4': 4, 'GPIOAO_6': 6, 'GPIOAO_8': 8, 'GPIOAO_9': 9, 'GPIOCLK_0': 98, 'GPIODV_26': 75, 'GPIODV_27': 76, 'GPIOX_0': 79, 'GPIOX_1': 80, 'GPIOX_10': 89, 'GPIOX_11': 90, 'GPIOX_12': 91, 'GPIOX_13': 92, 'GPIOX_14': 93, 'GPIOX_15': 94, 'GPIOX_16': 95, 'GPIOX_17': 96, 'GPIOX_18': 97, 'GPIOX_2': 81, 'GPIOX_3': 82, 'GPIOX_4': 83, 'GPIOX_5': 84, 'GPIOX_6': 85, 'GPIOX_7': 86, 'GPIOX_8': 87, 'GPIOX_9': 88}

Dictionary with GPIO pin names as keys and Linux pin number as values.
